title: Drawing, Design for Title Page "Occupations of Women and Their Compensation", late 19th century
title_raw: Design for Title Page "Occupations of Women and Their Compensation"
medium: Brush and gouache on paper, mounted on illustration board
signed:
Recto, in pen and black ink: AM mark
Verso, in pen and light blue ink: Design by Alice C. Morse
inscribed:
Verso from top to bottom of sheet:
Written in graphite: Gift of Morse, Alice / Sept. 22, 1943
Written in pen and black ink: Return to Alice Morse / 439 Wyoming Ave. / Scranton, Pa. 
Written in pen and light blue ink: Design by Alice C. Morse
Written in graphite: Book ornamentation - Title pages
description: A woman in black dress with gold band across her chest and medallion at center with letters AT, stands holding an open book with gold cover. Her hair is coiffed into a bob and pinned with three gold blossoms around a bun. Flanking the woman are two black lanterns with gold flames, green scrolled vines intertwined around the lanterns. Above the woman is written in black text: OCCUPATION / OF WOMEN AND THEIR / COMPENSATION.

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, Design for Title Page "Occupations of Women and Their Compensation", late 19th century. Brush and gouache on paper, mounted on illustration board. 
Gift of Alice C. Morse. 2009-6-55
